nodes.text: The drawers are scratched up where I jimmied the lock. The Master is going to be pissed off when he sees this. Hopefully, he won't figure out who did it.
The Raven isn't on the desk; maybe it's in one of the drawers? I need to find it soon. Then I have to figure out a way to get out of the castle and back to town tonight... somehow.
I've got to focus.
The papers on top of it are all either in code or in Germanish - kind of hard to tell the difference.
The drawers have a Marlowe lock on them... It's a tough one.
Fortunately, this Magical Key has no problem with the lock.
Let's see if my skills are up to these locks...
Damn... I should have practiced more with the Houdini tools!
I'm out of time and options. The Raven has to be in this desk or I'm sunk.
I'll have to try using the Magical Key instead.
Damn, nothing but papers in the top drawer.
The second drawer has a ledger book with grades in it. I could probably make sure I passed the class - if I had the time to play around with it. Shame it's so late.
One drawer to go... this better be it or it's back to the streets for me.
There's a letter here in the drawer - and it looks like my mother's handwriting!
It says, Sir Gerhard, I am Nora, wife of the late Donal O'Conner, who you may recall was the King of Thieves of Sardonia. I learn that you have returned to this land as an instructor of heroes.
When Donal passed away, you offered your service if ever I had need of it. Though it's been nigh onto fourteen years, I'm taking you to your word.

Our son, Shawn O'Conner, is a good lad. He's bright and bonny and the pride of my life. I fear that without aid, he'll follow his father's path. We none of us want that fate for him, Donal least of all.
Please, help my son become a Hero instead of a thief. Yours sincerely, Nora O'Conner
My mother knows Gerhard!
Actually, I knew both of your parents.
So my mother arranged for me to come to this school?
Yes. Your mother will be very pleased to learn how well you have done here at the school.
Your desk is nicely carved and looks very grand. It's a beautiful piece of furniture. You clearly have great taste. Did it come from your homeland?
Your attempt at subtle flattery is too heavy-handed. One needs to build such ingratiation a comment at a time rather than applying it on too thickly.
